page.title: 01Carrog
page.content: Carrog is a small village in North Wales. It is situated by the Dee River. It has a very small population. The Beryn mountains surround the village to the right. Most of this land is covered in pine trees. Carrog is known for its farming. There are a lot of farms in the area. But most of them are sheep farms. As the land is arable land. The valley is U shaped with the Dee flowing through it. The River is famous for its fish and Canoeing. A lot of competitions are held there. Most of the houses in Carrog are built from lcoal stone, so is the bridge, it was built in 17th and 18th centuary but renewed in the 1920s.
